title: Oregon shooter's identity as it was online
text:
Chris Harper-Mercer is now a name synonymous with Eric Harris, Dylan Klebold, James Holmes, Vester Flanagan and countless other shooters who have terrorized American citizens in public places.
But who was is Harper-Mercer, the 26 year old who fatally shot nine and wounded seven at an Oregon community college Thursday (Oct. 1) before dying in a shootout with police?
According to a dating profile he hadn't updated in more than three months, he was "not religious, but spiritual." He also identified as someone who "doesn't like organized religion."
Screenshot from SpiritualPassions.com Multiple reports say the shooter specifically targeted Christians, one victim told her father . After shooting the professor, the students took cover and were then asked to stand if they were Christian, according to her account . He then told them they were going to meet God before shooting them, she said.
The victim, Anastasia Boylan, is undergoing surgery for a bullet wound to her spine but is expected to survive .
Harper-Mercer was also the son of an interracial couple, and his Spiritual Passions dating profile says he was looking for a female of a similar ethnicity. His profile says he was a Leo and his stance on drugs was "never."
While there are few, if any, extreme red flags from the shooter's personality and online profiles, the most telling may be the fact that he grew up without a father figure , according to information his uncle relayed to the Daily Beast.
An Inquisitir roundup of Mercer's social media profiles reveals he was a supporter of the Irish Republican Army.
A Guardian report addresses rumors that a warning was posted to the messaging site 4chan early Thursday morning saying, "Don't go to school tomorrow if you are in the Northwest." The report also says, however, that verifying the source of the post is hard because all posts to the site "are by definition anonymous."
